traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The nonaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
entries: The nonaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
entries: If the nonaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The nonaton makes three Arm attacks and uses Pillar of Truth or Spellcasting.

actions.name: Arm
entries: Melee atk +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4 damage) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition grappled} condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the nonaton can't use this arm against other targets. The nonaton has nine arms, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Pillar of Truth
entries: The nonaton chooses a point on the ground that it can see within 60 feet of itself. A 60-foot-tall, 20-foot-radius cylinder of magical force rises from that point. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6 damage) force damage, and the creature reverts to its original form (if it's in a different form) and can't assume a different form until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
